lesson_name_and_number: Lesson 1 - Getting to know each other
good_at: He could learn quickly and asked good questions.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
Ending sounds, e.g. years, patient

2. Language Use: 
- My name Nam -> My name is Nam.
- I am marry -> I am married.
- I graduated at -> I graduated from
- I am a patient people -> I am a patient person.
- When I was younger, I enjoyed going fishing.
- take care my family -> take care of my family

3. New words: 
Approachable, introvert, extrovert

good_at: He knew how to use Neo's functional buttons and took full advantage of them to improve his pronunciation.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
- Ending sounds, e.g. chooses, drink, much, wrote, appeared
- Television, interesting, Max's

2. Language Use: 
They both try pay the bill. -> They both try to pay the bill.

3. New words: 
N.A.

good_at: He could use Present perfect and Simple past tenses correctly. He knew several words.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
- Ending sounds, e.g. customers, relationships
- Shampoo

2. Language Use: 
- I would be happy to travel quarterly on business.
- Suitable with -> suitable for

3. New words: 
First class, personalized service, affordable, travel expenses, transportation, accommodation, meals, entertainment, travel documents, cash and credit cards, shampoo

good_at: He could learn quickly.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
- Ending sounds, e.g. friends
- Clothes

2. Language Use: 
- must to go to school -> must go to school
- go to Japan for travel -> travel to Japan
- (the past) go to school -> went to school
- contact the hotel direction -> contact the hotel directly
- Vietnam and Japan have different time zones.
- I would recommend Sapa.

3. New words: 
travel agent, air sickness, take off, flight delays, long security lines, scenery, natural attractions, historical sites, museum

good_at: He could apply past knowledge effectively.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
Ending sounds, e.g. customers, speak, T-shirt

2. Language Use: 
- I think that I will never change my friendliness because it's important for my job.
- I like the changes because sometimes they can result in happiness.
- I must change the speak -> I must change the way I speak.
- Since I have a new job, I usually wear T-shirt -> Since I had a new job, I have changed the way I dress. I usually wear T-shirts.
- I usually spend a lot of time on social media.
- I want to reduce the amount of time that I spend on social media.
- I have not experienced any big changes in my life.

3. New words: 
personality, friendliness, habits

lesson_name_and_number: Lesson 6 - Urban life and Rural life
good_at: He could use a relatively wide range of vocabulary to discuss today's topic.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
- Ending sounds, e.g. lakes, areas
- Atmosphere
- Urban

2. Language Use: 
- There is many changes -> There are many changes.
- It might be more difficult to find a job that is suitable for me.
- There is not industrial country -> There are very few industrial areas.
- Farming jobs are easy to find in my hometown.
- People live in urban area is busy than rural area -> People who live in urban areas are busier than people who live in ural areas.
- I like live in -> I like to live in
- Rural area will better -> Rural areas will be better.

3. New words: 
urban area, rural area, geography

good_at: He could learn quickly and use agreement/ disagreement phrases.
need_to_improve:

Facebook, advanatges, disadvantages

2. Language Use: 
- I use social media for communication, building professional connections, and staying in touch with my friends.

- Some disadvantages of social networks are loss of privacy and greater potential for identity theft.
- Social media can be helpful for businesses.

identity theft, cyberbullying, fake news, reconnect

good_at: He was cooperative and willing to learn new words and phrases.

cuisine, customs, history, trousers

- In Vietnamese culture, older people are treated with great respect.
- I will advise for him wearing -> I will advise him to wear

unique, national costumes, cuisine, customs, history, social beliefs, respect, shirt

good_at: He was cooperative and proactive.

good_at: He could learn quickly and had a relatively wide range of vocabulary.
need_to_improve:

career, their, decisive, satisfied

2. Language Use: 
- Two years ago, I decided to change my job.
- (Talking about the past) It is not change my life -> It did not change my life.
-  (Talking about the past) I felt worried.
- accept the job offer
- It take about once a week -> It takes me a week to make an important decision.

- It depends on the situation.

force, dissatisfied, survey, decide, decisive

good_at: He was cooperative and proactive.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
- Ending sounds, e.g. cities
- Their, encourage, transportation, spread

2. Language Use: 
- Large cities can encourage people to use public transportation or bike to work to improve their air quality.
- Large cities can improve their air quality by encouraging people to use public transportation or bike to work.
- We can use media to spread the message.
- We can create posters that highlight the impact of pollution on our environment.

air pollution, noise pollution, bother, private transportation, awareness, media, spread

good_at: Nam is cooperative. He put an effort to learn and use new words.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
- Mispronunciation: coffee, wife, their, 


2. Language Use: 
- I graduated at > from high school.
- I have a child / I have 2 children.
- At their young age, being able to ride a bicycle was an important milestone for most of the kids.
- My first job was in a different field from my current job.
- There were many difficulties when I changed the job.
- I needed some time to get used to the new job.
- The college I went to is close to my house.
- I'm happy with my current life.
- I met my wife at the company I used to work.
- The first day we met,...
- I don't want to return to be a kid.
- I spend more time for my family.
- We only have a celebration for the wedding day.

3. New words: 
- Significant other: người thương
- Similarity (số nhiều: similarities): điểm chung
- Celebration: lễ kỉ niệm
- Milestone (n): cột mốc

1. Pronunciation:

good_at: He was cooperative and willing to learn new words and phrases.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
Mispronunciation: information, kilometers, confident, tired,


2. Language Use: 
- I will never went to > I will never to go pulic areas during holidays.

- I and my family > My family and I went to the park.

- To avoid the bad experience in the past, I will use online booking apps to book the hotel rooms in advance.

- When we were students, we cheated in exams quite often. 

- When I was a students, I used to be caught by the teacher for cheating not just once but many times.

- The first time I made a speech in front of a lot of people, I was just reading from my notes.

- To avoid getting nervous, I'll take a deep breath or look at the screen instead of looking at the audience.

- Before the presentation, I will rehearse with my coworkers or my wife.

- My wife is very supportive. She always gives me good advice to improve my presentation.

3. New words: 
- Book something in advance: đặt trước 1 dịch vụ gì đó
- Catch someone red-handed: bắt quả tang ai đó
- Take a deep breath: hít thở sâu
- Rehearse (v): tập dợt
- Audience (n): khán giả
- Supportive (adj): đem lại sự giúp đỡ

good_at: Nam was very proactive and puntual. He improved his pronunciation and fluency.
need_to_improve:
1. Pronunciation: 
- Mispronunciation: atmosphere, progress, words with final -s sounds

2. Language Use: 
- Bosses are usually strict because they want to create a professional working environment.
- They make sure the employees can keep up with the progress.
- Know the difference between: 
        + Employee: someone who is paid to work for someone else 
        + Employer: a person, company, or organization that pays people to work for them

- They give a task without giving/ providing any instruction
- To run a large company effectively, a boss should make a good plan. This includes considering finances, product development, and marketing plans

3. New words: 
- Discuss: to talk about something

good_at:
- Be able to talk about future plans but when talking about past events, she still makes mistakes by using present tenses.
- Ms.Dieu needs to extend her answers longer and produce more information. For example, when talking about her incoming holiday plans - go back to her hometown, she can say the reasons why she chooses to visit her hometown instead of traveling to another city/ country (I haven't met my parents for such a long time, I miss them so much... I don't like traveling during peak season because it's so crowded and expensive...), how can she get there (I'm going to take a bus to Vung Tau city...)

good_at:
- You did a good job of introducing yourself and giving some basic information about your name and your work. However, you could improve your grammar and pronunciation in some areas. For example, you can say “I’m working as a/an + position at A&E” or “I’m working for A&E as a + position”. / "My name is Ngoc Dieu, you can call me Esther."
- You also gave a clear and coherent description of your trip or holiday. You used the correct structure and vocabulary to talk about the trip. You also used some connectors and transitions to make your speech more fluent and organized. But try to make your answers longer and in details, by talking about destination, transportation, companions, duration, activities, and opinion. You could also use some adjectives and adverbs to make your speech more descriptive and expressive, such as “beautiful”, “amazing”, “quickly”, or “carefully”.
- You also expressed your opinion about urban life versus rural life. You gave some reasons and consequences to support your preference. You used some appropriate words and phrases to compare and contrast the two lifestyles, such as “firstly”, “secondly”, “on the other hand”, or “in contrast”.  You could also use some examples or anecdotes to make your speech more interesting and convincing.
